I've heard of many cases where cops have taken their time to talk down or 
even chase down grown men with guns, some even waving their guns around - 
just that none of those men were black. Shooting a kid who had done nothing 
wrong but ran away from you is just plain wrong. Even if you suspected him 
of having a gun, he did not point it at you or anyone for that matter, he 
just ran away. Let's not forget that there are other cases where cops have 
shot unarmed civilians for just running away, so this is nothing new.﻿

+David Rook Cops can only use deadly force if they believe that either 
they, or someone else is in imminent danger - a kid running away is not 
imminent danger - if he was gonna attack he would have instead of running 
away. That's why they call it flight or fight, not flight and fight.
go fuck yourself

+Smoke   Yes, lets chase down an armed suspect, and hope while chasing they 
don't turn around and shoot your butt.

The cops should have not fired immediately, the kid should have thought of 
his decision to bring a gun, the mom should have stopped him.﻿

usually done within split seconds.

shoot. But in the report they were still investigating so we will have to

happened to that boy but that goes without saying. Can't imagine what the 
family of the boy or what the police officer is going through right now 
either. Chill out you're going to give yourself a heart attack.

I've read a bunch of comments and I have to say the following. (I know I'll 
catch hell from a lot of liberal pansies on this but too bad).

1. Yes the gun looked real.
2. Yes mom should have never let it out of the house (except in the 
dumpster).

HOWEVER when I was growing up ALL toy guns looked 'real as fuck' as some of 
you say, and when you pulled the trigger they went BANG, not crack, not 
pop, but BANG, and had smoke that came out of the barrel, and not ONCE 
during my entire childhood did a SINGLE cop shoot a kid for playing with 
one of these. They used to drive through the neighbor hood and see kids 
carrying these and pointing them and shooting them ALL THE TIME, and NOT 
ONCE did the cops even so much as stop to bother any of us let alone point 
THEIR gun at us.

HOW MANY young kids (early teens and younger, you know, the age that likes 
to play cops and robbers, cowboys and Indians etc) have SHOT a cop? Like 
ZERO?? So why the hell are cops pointing guns at these kids in the first 
place?!?! They've become OVERLY PARANOID, and have been TRAINED over the 
last few decades to shoot first and ask questions later. Doesn't matter 
WHAT color your skin is, this has become epidemic.

Cops have simply become trigger happy. WHY? Because they get a PAID 
vacation while the pseudo-investigation is carried out, and are put back on 
the street as soon as they're cleared. Society as a whole has given them 
the GREEN LIGHT to be pussified into shooting anything that moves. Kids, 
moms holding babies, those deadly chihuahua's penned up in the kitchen...

Look at the police in other countries. Watch some "I love Russia" video's 
and watch the cops walk up to grown men with guns and simply take them away 
without drawing their own. The problem is our cops have become pussies that 
are afraid of their own shadows (and the way they've been treating the 
citizens over the last 30 years or so, they may be vindicated in their 
fear).

Here's a thought. Since ANYONE with a conscience would have problems 
functioning in a safe and normal manner after having shot someone the 
following rule should be put into place REGARDLESS of if the shooting was 
justified or not.

Any officer who causes severe physical harm or death to an individual in 
the course of his duties will be terminated immediately. If evidence proves 
that the officer was not only justified in causing said harm, but would 
have more likely than not lost his or her life or failed to protect the 
life of another by using less force, then said officer will be allowed to 
return to work at previous rank and pay after 1 year with counseling. Just 
like long term disability is set up for normal jobs is used to pay people 
that are out of work for a period of time, they should be able to file for 
disability for a 'stress related injury' while they are off for the year 
receiving counseling and the officer would be able to collect from the day 
of the incident if the above is determined to be the case. If an officer 
has caused death or great bodily harm and it's proven that he or a citizen 
WOULDN'T have been injured or killed, then that officer is no longer 
working for the police and would be barred from working in any form of law 
enforcement AND criminal charges of assault or murder will be filed.

What would this accomplish? Well being that it was a toy gun, they couldn't 
say they prevented their own or someone else from being injured, since a 
toy gun wouldn't be capable of doing so. Someone beaten beyond recognition 
or choked to death simply for resisting would also fall under that 
category. It would cause the officer to be less of a mindless pussy, and 
force them to THINK before pulling the trigger on a kid, or a baton on 
someone for resisting. Tazers work, once the cuffs are on there's no need 
to beat the shit out of someone. I don't care HOW big a guy is you don't 
need to choke them when you have a dozen or so cops to sit on them (they 
will get tired eventually). Each case would have to be looked at 
individually, and a JURY should rule on the justification, not a POLICE 
INVESTIGATION BOARD. This would protect the officer that was TRULY 
justified in his actions to save a life, and STOP the bullies from having 
absolute unimpeachable power.

Is there a possibility that an officer COULD lose their life by hesitating? 
Not if they KNEW what they were doing. A grown man isn't out playing cops 
and robbers. If he draws, you bet you defend yourself. If a 6 year old has 
a silver plated six shooter loaded with caps, or a BB gun, you might want 
to pass on that one (or at least wait until they shoot first, because 
chances are even if it IS real, they aren't going to be very good shots).

It's time we start hiring cops with balls that aren't AFRAID to do their 
jobs without pulling the pistol the first 5 seconds of an encounter where 
they aren't being SHOT AT.

Begin hateful replies and trolling now......
(Before you do though, just know I was trained in police work in the early 
1970's and had some of my friends I trained with were shot while on duty. 
We WEREN'T trained to shoot first and ask questions later, we were trained 
to SERVE AND PROTECT not ENSLAVE and HANDICAP).﻿

Mike H

My first thought was 'Oh B'more cops, here we go again'. Then I saw what 
the narrator says is the actual fake gun in question. If that is in fact 
the one, it looks every bit a real gun unless you are inches away. It makes 
me wonder why toymakers aren't prohibited from making toys even closely 
resembling real ones. A painted tip is not enough. If they all looked even 
like the giant squirt guns, I am sure kids would still buy them up for 
whatever roleplay. The benefit is cases such as in this vid wouldn't 
happen, and people who stage holdups with convincing looking fakes would 
lose the advantage in creating fear. This should be addressed for change. 
But today this is one case where cops actually followed their training. 
Good.﻿
